result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin R Mech was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid as follows:  $20 payable to Open Pantry and $20 payable to the victim (K.A.).  Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through if deemed appropriate by Agent.
No contact with co-actor (C.K.) and no VIOLENT contact with the victim (A.B.).
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant has provided DNA sample.
Defendant to contact Probation by 09:00 a.m. on 02-16-2016.

Cash bail applied to Court costs and DNA surcharge.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Justin R Mech in court with attorney Kathleen Byrne Stilling.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.




Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  4 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Concurrent to anyother probation.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through if deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Co-Actor (C.K.) and No Violent Contact with victim (A.B.).
DNA sample to be provided - Already Provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Defendant to contact Probation by 9 am tomorrow 02/16/16.

RESTITUTION:  $40 (Breakdown:  $20 to Open Pantry and $20 to Victim (K.A.) - restitution to be paid before costs or fines) - to be paid within first 6 months.
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample - (Already Given) and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditons).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

for Return/Destruction of Exhibits

Defendant Justin R Mech in court with attorney Kathleen Byrne Stilling.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  Atty. Stilling requests witness be sequestered.  Witnesses are sequestered.  City of Brookfield police officer Eric Bills sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Boese.  Exhibit #1 marked.  Cross examination by Atty. Stilling.  Redirect.  Recross.  United States Secret Service special agent Michael Floyd sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Boese.  Cross examination by Atty. Stilling.  Redirect.  Exhibit #1 offered and received.  State moves for bind over.  Atty. Stilling moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
